attributes.action: Include NHS staff who gave their lives during COVID19 pandemic in Nov ceremonies
attributes.additional_details: Never in living memory outside of military conflict has so much been asked of any group of individuals. They have carried on their vital work willingly all the while knowing the potential consequences. The risk and rigour is unquestionable and it is only right that they are remembered alongside our nation’s glorious dead from past conflicts. Greater love has no one than this: to lay down one's life for one's friends.
attributes.background: All NHS and healthcare staff who have laid down their lives during the COVID19 pandemic should be remembered during the 11th November ceremonies this year. A roll of honour should be read aloud at the Cenotaph on the first Remembrance Day following the lifting of social distancing.

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for the National Service of Remembrance. This is organised by the Royal British Legion and through ex-service and related civilian associations.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Designate a day for the recognition of our NHS and all Emergency Services: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308614

National holiday of remembrance of those who died during the virus covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/311923

A memorial for NHS, care, allied professionals, who die as a result of COVID:19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313328 

Create a National Covid-19 Key worker memorial Commemorate the fallen: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315516 

Commission a Memorial Plaque to honour and remember UK victims of the Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310097
